title: Ticket #5051: condor_chirp set_job_attr_delayed not documented correctly
description:
the documentation for condor_chirp set_job_attr_delayed does not mention it's special behaviors.

  • it does not require WantIOProxy
  • it will only accept attributes who's names begin with Chirp (case sensitive, at present)
  • it takes about 15 minutes for delayed attribute changes to be visible in the schedd.
remarks:
2016-Sep-08 16:18:51 by tannenba:
The above says must start with case-sensitive string "Chirp". FWIW, I don't think this is true - I think it can be case-insensitive.

2016-Sep-08 16:27:57 by tannenba:
More troubling is the documentation talk about knob REMOTE_UPDATE_PREFIX, which does not exist. The real name is CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX, and it is a list of wild-card prefixes. Manual patch forthcoming.
check_ins:
2016-Sep-08 16:28   Check-in [49159]: Corrected name for knob CHIRP_DELAYED_UPDATE_PREFIX in manual. #5051 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2015-Jun-01 12:13   Check-in [44923]: doc update for condor_chirp option. #5051 (By Karen Miller )
creator: johnkn
